item.title: [SUREFIRE-1177] TestNG "suitethreadpoolsize" parameter can not be set by Maven Surefire
item.description:
Because of Surefire is using deprecated TestNG.configure(Map) method, parameter "suitethreadpoolsize" value is not read by TestNG. And so test suites can not be run in parallel. This parameter is read only in TestNG.configure(CommandLineArgs) method.

/**

  • This method is invoked by Maven's Surefire to configure the runner,
  • do not remove unless you know for sure that Surefire has been updated
  • to use the new configure(CommandLineArgs) method.
    *
  • @deprecated use new configure(CommandLineArgs) method
    */
    @Deprecated
    public void configure(Map cmdLineArgs) {
    ....
item.summary: TestNG "suitethreadpoolsize" parameter can not be set by Maven Surefire

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
right, we are not calling TestNG.configure(CommandLineArgs).
Since what version of TestNG this method was introduced?
Maybe you should introduce a new implementation of interface:
org.apache.maven.surefire.testng.conf.Configurator
Are all other parameters used in the new method TestNG.configure(CommandLineArgs) as well? Check what params are used in surefire now. See our parameters in TestNGMapConfigurator.getConvertedOptions().
Please, communicate with TestNG creators directly to find together the right way to solve Surefire - TestNG interface communication problems. Thanks a lot.

In the open source you should open a new pull request in GitHub and
try to fix it.
Our task is not to ask TestNG team because we should help you to make
proper fix in code review in GitHub.

–
Cheers
Tibor

dundacek
I am using TestNG 6.8, and surefire configuration parallel=methods with threadCount=2, one class and two methods and both run in parallel.
Can you attach your test project in a zip file in JIRA?
Thx.
Methods can be run in parallel, it is ok. The problem is that test suites can not be run in parallel.

We need your test project in order to reproduce this issue.
I only guess that your plugin configuration is parallel=suites. If it's so I have to say that parallel parameter accepts only methods or classes and this issues is then supposed to be a new feature.
Remember that Maven project has a rule where Jira issues without having attached reproducible project can be closed after 3 months.

I don´t meant "parallel=suites" configuration option, although such a new feature would be nice.

I only want to pass the "suitethreadpoolsize" parameter value into TestNG in any way.

When starting TestNG directly, with suitethreadpoolsize parameter, test suites are running in parallel ok, e.g.:
java org.testng.TestNG -suitethreadpoolsize 3 testng1.xml testng2.xml testng3.xml
or similar example (when more test suite files are included inside testng.xml):
java org.testng.TestNG -suitethreadpoolsize 3 testng.xml

But when starting TestNG by Maven Surefire plugin, there is no such possibility. For example:
<configuration>
<suitethreadpoolsize>3</suitethreadpoolsize>
<suiteXmlFiles>
<suiteXmlFile>testng1.xml</suiteXmlFile>
<suiteXmlFile>testng2.xml</suiteXmlFile>
<suiteXmlFile>testng2.xml</suiteXmlFile>
</suiteXmlFiles>
</configuration>

doesn't work. There is no possibility (as I know) to pass suitethreadpoolsize parameter value to TestNG, when starting by Maven Surefire.

There is class TestNGExecutor to touch.
Why you don't want to introduce a new configuration parameter
"commandLineArgsTestNG" to customize TestNG, or alternatively extend
parameter "parallel". I guess such work in well known open source
project like Maven is ambitious for every developer, hm?

–
Cheers
Tibor

We have to update documentation regarding parallel exec in TestNG with use of these parameters and trivial use cases for each.

As a hint for `dataproviderthreadcount` you can print `ConcurrentHashMap#size()` and assert that string `concurrency=30.` appears in console lines. You would need to put a little delay 100 millis where iterations 1000 would be enough to have.
This way you do not need any performance test - no need to assert exec time which is always dependent on CPU in build park.

Regarding `suitethreadpoolsize` is there any way to print verbose configuration by TestNG?
Other possibility would be to implement `ITestListener` remember time of the first `onStart` and time of last `oninish` and compute the diff time. This would be the performance test, but it may vary 1.0 sec in overloaded build park.
One way or another the IT should assert that all suites run successfully.

Are we agree that the current PR is more about parameters than threading?

Before the fix: "-suitethreadpoolsize" and "-dataproviderthreadcount" were sent without conversion to TestNG, but TestNG need `Integer`.
After the fix: "-suitethreadpoolsize" and "-dataproviderthreadcount" are sent with conversion to TestNG, what it supposed to be done.

@dundacek already made [a fix](https://github.com/cbeust/testng/pull/798) into TestNG for "-suitethreadpoolsize" but not for "-dataproviderthreadcount". And I think we are all agree that TestNG is not the good place for that.

What I propose is to merge my fix because it has no risk ("-suitethreadpoolsize" and "-dataproviderthreadcount" are `Integer` since the begginning) and it will help users, then we can try to improve parallel and/or use the "new" TestNG method.
